titleStmt.title: TO THE VALEROVS AND TRVELY MAGNANIMOVS KNIGHT SYR EDWARD DYMMOCKE, THE KINGS CHAMPION.
titleStmt.author: Corkine, William

analytic.title: TO THE VALEROVS AND TRVELY MAGNANIMOVS KNIGHT SYR EDWARD DYMMOCKE, THE KINGS CHAMPION.
analytic.author: Corkine, William

monogr.title: The second booke of ayres : some, to sing and play to the base-violl alone: others, to be sung to the lute and base violl. VVith new corantoes, pauins, almaines; as also diuers new descants vpon old grounds, set to the lyra-violl
monogr.author: Corkine, William

div.head: TO THE VALEROVS AND TRVELY MAGNANIMOVS KNIGHT SYR EDWARD DYMMOCKE, THE KINGS CHAMPION.
div.p: AS a poore man, indebted to many, and desirous to pay what hee can, deuides that little hee hath among many, to giue contentment, at least, to some: so, I (right Worthy SYR) am constrayned to make the like distribution of this poore Mite of mine; being all I haue, for the present, to content you my Worthiest Creditors. But first, for that I stand most obliged to you, euen Conscience moues mee to shew my willingnesse to satisfie you first. Your approued and generally-beloued Noble-Nature (resembling that Diuine) will (I hope) take my Will for Deed, who in both euer will be

closer.signed: Yours intirely to dispose, William Corkine.
